title: 79/280. Human resources management
text:
United Nations 
A/RES/79/280 
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
16 April 2025 
 
25-06205 (E) 
*2506205* 
 
 
Seventy-ninth session 
Agenda item 144 
Human resources management 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 11 April 2025 
 
 
 
 
[on the report of the Fifth Committee (A/79/839, para. 7)] 
 
 
 79/280. Human resources management 
 
 
 
The General Assembly 
 
1. 
Recalls paragraph 5 of its resolution 78/275 of 24 April 2024, and notes 
that rule 3.3 of the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations continues to 
read as follows:  
 
“(a) On appointment, a staff member shall normally be placed at the first 
step of the level of his or her post, unless otherwise decided by the Secretary-
General. 
 
“(b) On promotion, a staff member who holds a fixed-term or a continuing 
appointment shall be placed at the lowest step of the level to which he or she 
has been promoted that provides an increase in net base salary equal to at least 
the amount that would have resulted from the granting of two steps at the lower 
level.” 
 
2. 
Stresses that paragraph 66 of its resolution 79/257 of 24 December 2024 
does not relate to cases of “promotions” under staff rule 3.3 (b); 
 
3. 
Also stresses that any changes to the “Guidelines for determination of level 
and step on recruitment to the Professional category and above” by the Secretary-
General shall be fully in line with resolutions and decisions of the General Assembly. 
 
63rd plenary meeting 
11 April 2025
